news_header: The WHO has reported that programs addressing HIV, polio, mpox, and bird flu have been severely impacted by the US government's freeze on overseas aid, which amounts to tens of billions of dollars.
news_original_title: Fifty countries affected by USAID freeze, says WHO
news_text: WHO chief Dr. Tedros has urged the Trump administration to resume aid funding, highlighting disruptions in HIV treatments across 50 countries. The cuts have led to clinic closures and health worker layoffs, raising concerns about disease spread and delays in vaccine development. The US has also reduced its collaboration with WHO and reporting on bird flu cases. Experts call for a long-term solution to address the shortages in life-saving medications.
